TitleSelect: Gender Roles: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring Gender Roles: Expectations and Realities"
ListenList: Do you see yourself as a typical man or woman? Why or why not?
Maria sees herself as a typical woman because she enjoys traditional roles.
John doesn't see himself as a typical man because he likes activities usually associated with women.
Anna feels she is a mix of both typical and non-typical gender roles.
In your country, are the responsibilities of a mother the same as the responsibilities of a father to their families?
Maria thinks mothers and fathers have different but equally important responsibilities.
John believes responsibilities should be shared equally between mothers and fathers.
Anna feels that traditionally, mothers have more nurturing roles while fathers are providers.
What are the responsibilities of a father to his family?
Maria believes a father's responsibility is to provide financial support and protection.
John thinks fathers should also be involved in emotional support and daily caregiving.
Anna feels fathers should balance between providing and nurturing.
What are the responsibilities of a mother to her family?
Maria says mothers are responsible for caring for children and managing the household.
John believes mothers should also contribute to the family income.
Anna feels mothers should balance between career and home responsibilities.
Are fathers capable of carrying out the duties of a mother and vice versa?
Maria thinks fathers can do many duties of mothers but not all.
John believes both parents can interchangeably carry out each other's duties.
Anna feels it depends on the individual parents and their skills.
Are there different expectations for sons and daughters?
Maria believes society still has different expectations for boys and girls.
John thinks expectations are becoming more equal.
Anna feels that while expectations are changing, traditional views still exist.
What habits are deemed as appropriate for men but inappropriate for women?
Maria says smoking and drinking are more acceptable for men than women.
John believes habits should not be gender-specific.
Anna feels society judges women more harshly for behaviors like smoking.
What behaviors are deemed as appropriate for men but inappropriate for women?
Maria believes assertiveness is seen as positive in men but negative in women.
John thinks both men and women should be allowed to be assertive.
Anna feels women are often labeled as aggressive for the same behaviors men are praised for.
What jobs are deemed as appropriate for men but inappropriate for women?
Maria says construction work is often seen as a man's job.
John believes any job can be done by both men and women.
Anna feels there are still stereotypes but they are breaking down.
Are more doctors female or male in your country?
Maria says there are more male doctors in her country.
John thinks the number of female doctors is increasing.
Anna believes it depends on the specialty within the medical field.
Are more nurses female or male in your country?
Maria says most nurses are female in her country.
John agrees that nursing is predominantly female.
Anna feels there are more male nurses now than before.
Are more professional musicians female or male in your country?
Maria says there are more male professional musicians.
John thinks there are many successful female musicians as well.
Anna feels it depends on the genre of music.
Are more teachers female or male in your country?
Maria says there are more female teachers.
John agrees, especially in primary education.
Anna feels that male teachers are more common in higher education.
Are more truck drivers female or male in your country?
Maria says most truck drivers are male.
John agrees that truck driving is male-dominated.
Anna feels this is slowly changing as more women enter the field.
Are men and women equal in ability and intelligence?
Maria believes men and women are equal in ability and intelligence.
John thinks both genders have different strengths but are overall equal.
Anna feels that societal factors often influence perceived differences in ability and intelligence.
What things can either men or women do that the other cannot do and why?
Maria says only women can give birth.
John believes men cannot naturally breastfeed.
Anna feels both genders can do most things, but biological differences create some limitations.
What type of clothing do men wear?
Maria says men typically wear trousers, shirts, and suits.
John thinks men also wear casual clothes like jeans and t-shirts.
Anna feels men can wear a wide range of clothing depending on personal style.
What type of clothing do women wear?
Maria says women typically wear dresses, skirts, and blouses.
John thinks women also wear trousers and suits.
Anna feels women have more variety in clothing choices.
Can men wear women's clothing or can women wear men's clothing? Why or why not?
Maria believes men and women can wear each other's clothing but society might judge them.
John thinks clothing should not be restricted by gender norms.
Anna feels fashion is becoming more gender-neutral, allowing more freedom in clothing choices.
Can men wear pink clothes?
Maria believes men can wear pink, but it might still be seen as unconventional.
John thinks men should feel free to wear any color, including pink.
Anna feels that fashion trends are making pink more acceptable for men.

seo.Topic: Exploring Gender Roles: Expectations and Realities
seo.Title: Exploring Gender Roles: Expectations and Realities
seo.metaTitle: Gender Roles: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring Gender Roles: Expectations and Realities"
seo.metaDescription: Discover societal expectations and realities regarding gender roles, including responsibilities, stereotypes, and equality.

contentArray.content: Exploring Gender Roles: Expectations and Realities
Examining how individuals perceive themselves in relation to traditional gender roles.
Comparing the societal expectations of fathers versus mothers in your country.
Discussing the appropriateness of behaviors, occupations, and clothing based on gender stereotypes.
